description: The Great Gatsby has garnered over 4500 reviews with an impressive 4.5-star rating. Published in 1925, this classic explores themes of wealth, love, and the American Dream during the Jazz Age.
To Kill a Mockingbird holds a 4.8-star rating with 5200 reviews. Published in 1960, this novel addresses profound issues of racial injustice and moral growth set in the deep South.
1984 has received 6700 reviews with a strong 4.6-star rating. Published in 1949, Orwell's dystopian masterpiece delves into the dangers of totalitarianism and constant surveillance.
With 3400 reviews and a 4.7-star rating, Pride and Prejudice, published in 1813, continues to charm readers with its witty commentary on love, class, and society.
The Catcher in the Rye has 2900 reviews with a solid 4.2-star rating. Published in 1951, this novel explores the complex feelings of adolescence and alienation through the eyes of Holden Caulfield.
With 6200 reviews and a stellar 4.9-star rating, The Hobbit, published in 1937, takes readers on an unforgettable journey of adventure and discovery in Middle-Earth.
The Alchemist holds a 4.3-star rating from 7800 reviews. Published in 1988, it is a philosophical novel that blends adventure with deep spiritual messages about following one's dreams.
The Road has 3300 reviews with a strong 4.4-star rating. Published in 2006, this haunting novel follows a father and son as they struggle to survive in a post-apocalyptic world.

bookName: Sapiens: A Brief History of Humankind
description: Sapiens has received 8900 reviews with a 4.7-star rating. Published in 2011, it offers a sweeping narrative of human history from the earliest days to modern times.
